intro: Salvia anatolica, commonly known as Anatolian sage, is a perennial herb native to Turkey and the surrounding regions of the Eastern Mediterranean. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, producing spikes of violet to purple flowers. Salvia anatolica is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
